## Gene Details:
- **Gene ID:** [AT2G40190](https://www.arabidopsis.org/locus?name=AT2G40190)
- **Gene Symbol:** <u>LEW3</u>
- **Gene Name:** LEAF WILTING 3
- **Description:**   UDP-Glycosyltransferase superfamily protein;(source:Araport11)
- **TAIR Accession:** 
- **Genome:** [Araport11_genome_release](https://www.arabidopsis.org/download/list?dir=Genes%2FAraport11_genome_release)
- **Species:** *Arabidopsis thaliana*

## Transcripts:
   -  [AT2G40190.1](https://www.arabidopsis.org/gene?name=AT2G40190.1)
## Germplasm Phenotype:
   - [lew3]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;leaf-wilting; when grown at 21-22C, mutant plants are smaller, have shorter siliques and are less fertile than the wild-type plants.  Growth phenotype is partially rescued at higher temperatures (25-26C); collapsed xylem with reduced cellulose content; more sensitive to osmotic stress and ABA.
## Literature:
   - [LEW3, encoding a putative alpha-1,2-mannosyltransferase (ALG11) in N-linked  glycoprotein, plays vital roles in cell-wall biosynthesis and the abiotic stress  response in Arabidopsis thaliana.](https://www.doi.org/10.1111/j.1365-313X.2009.04013.x)&nbsp;&nbsp;DOI:&nbsp;&nbsp;[10.1111/j.1365-313X.2009.04013.x](https://www.doi.org/10.1111/j.1365-313X.2009.04013.x);&nbsp;&nbsp;PMID:&nbsp;&nbsp;[19732381](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/19732381/)
   - [A light-sensitive mutation in Arabidopsis LEW3 reveals the important role of  N-glycosylation in root growth and development.](https://www.doi.org/10.1093/jxb/erx324)&nbsp;&nbsp;DOI:&nbsp;&nbsp;[10.1093/jxb/erx324](https://www.doi.org/10.1093/jxb/erx324);&nbsp;&nbsp;PMID:&nbsp;&nbsp;[29106622](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29106622/)
